{"step_by_step_thinking": "The mandibular 1st molar typically has 5 cusps - 2 buccal, 2 lingual, and 1 distal. The mandibular 2nd molar also typically has 5 cusps - 2 buccal, 2 lingual, and 1 distal. The maxillary 1st molar typically has 4 cusps - 2 buccal and 2 lingual. The mandibular 3rd molar, or wisdom tooth, can vary greatly in its structure due to its position and often does not fully develop, but it typically has fewer than 5 cusps.", "answer_choice": "D. Maxillary 1st Molar"}
